name: Southwestern Chopped Salad with Cilantro Lime Dressing
description: A tex-mex style salad with an incredibly creamy Greek yogurt cilantro dressing!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup canned black beans (drained and rinsed)

itemListElement.text: Combine cilantro, Greek yogurt, garlic and lime juice in the bowl of a food processor. With the motor running, add olive oil and vinegar in a slow stream until emulsified; set aside.
itemListElement.name: Combine cilantro, Greek yogurt, garlic and lime juice in the bowl of a food processor. With the motor running, add olive oil and vinegar in a slow stream until emulsified; set aside.

itemListElement.text: To assemble the salad, place romaine lettuce in a large bowl; top with tomatoes, corn, black beans and cilantro. Pour the dressing on top of the salad and gently toss to combine. Stir in avocado.
itemListElement.name: To assemble the salad, place romaine lettuce in a large bowl; top with tomatoes, corn, black beans and cilantro. Pour the dressing on top of the salad and gently toss to combine. Stir in avocado.

itemListElement.text: Serve immediately, garnished with tortillas strips, if desired.
itemListElement.name: Serve immediately, garnished with tortillas strips, if desired.

review.reviewBody: My guess is that your olive oil was rancid... Rancid oil can give things a terrible taste. (It's a similar problem with rancid nuts and I know from experience that rancid ingredients totally ruin food... Strong, bitter, horrible aftertaste.)

This is one of me and my moms absolute favourite salads. I’ve made it probably 20 times in the past two years. One tip I have is if you wash your cilantro, make sure it’s nice and dry before you make the dressing or your dressing will not be as good. I learned the hard way.
I swear I could live off of all your recipes!! I love this salad!! Do you have a recipe foe a cilantro chimichurri, that would last a few days in the fridge? Thanks for all of your recipes!
I tried the recipe, loved it. Thank you
Made it according to the recipe.  Beautiful ingredients and I had high hopes.  Maybe my cloves of garlic were unusually large, because I found the dressing waaaaay too strong of garlic.
The only thing missing from this recipe is HEAT!  To really enjoy it, add two jalapeno peppers, finely diced to the salad, and some Texas Pete or other hot sauce to taste to the dressing.  Ole!
